section.name: Features
section.p: Below is an incomplete list of the main features of Artifactory:

ol.li: Can be run in a matter of minutes out of the box (with default configuration) by simply unpacking the downloadable archive and running the embedded Jetty container
Can be deployed as a regular web application to any standard servlet container
Configured using a single XML file backed up by a well defined schema
Security related configuration via web UI.
Easy separation of 3rd parties/in-house artifacts, or snapshots/releases/plugins artifacts
Import/Export for each local repository to the file system (via web UI)
Scheduled backups of local repositories

td.b: Import/Export and Backup to standard Maven 2 file-based repositories

ol.li: Each repository declared in Artifactory (Local and Cache of remote) can be "dumped", "loaded" and backup to a standard maven2 repository file layout.

This removes your long-term dependency on Artifactory (all your artifacts inside Artifactory Derby DB only), since you can stop using Artifactory and use the backup or "dumped" folders as standard maven2 repository.
The "dump", "restore" enables Artifactory upgrades even when the DB schema changes.
Fully authenticated access (web based and through Maven)
Advanced repository/repository paths based permissions for admins, deployers and viewers
Auditing for the last deployer of an artifact
Allow/disallow anonymous read (and anonymous artifact downloads)
System-wide admins
Check for correct artifact paths
Check for artifacts compliance with the target repository's policies
Ajax-based web UI using the excellent Wicket and Dojo frameworks
Lazy loading explorer-like navigation for all groups and artifacts in local, caches and remote repositories
Search artifacts in all repositories
Display POM with a snippet for inclusion as a POM dependency
Download artifacts directly from the web interface
Contextual menu for viewing POMs, removing artifacts, or zapping the caches
Artifact deployment via a web page, including ability to specify classifier

td.b: Fine tuned control for remote and local repositories

ol.li: Blackout a repository
Include/exclude patterns for allowed artifacts
Network timeouts
Fine grained cache expiry control for missed artifact, communication errors and regular retrievals
Go through HTTP proxies (including NTLM-based proxies)
Setup a group of Artifactory instances treating one another as remote repositories
Support for distributed, multi time zone enterprise development environments
